info.game_comments: 2009-2010 Million Dollar Celebrity Invitational quarterfinal game 2.

(1, 1).clue: You're in the Army now--in 1940 FDR instituted the first peacetime one of these in U.S. history

(2, 1).clue: Cubby O'Brien & Annette Funicello were 2 members of this Disney TV group

(3, 1).clue: The title of this 1951 J.D. Salinger book doesn't refer to a boozy baseball player

(4, 1).clue: On Tennis magazine's list of the 40 greatest players from 1965 to 2005, she's the top female player

(5, 1).clue: The "Best (and Worst!) of 2008" issue had "My Year of Surprises"; she "Talks About Marriage, Men and 'Marley & Me'"

(1, 2).clue: This term for a mechanical device can also be an organization running city politics, like NYC's Tammany Hall

(2, 2).clue: Edna O'Brien's frank depiction of women's lives has gotten her books banned in this, her native country

(3, 2).clue: Before "The Lord of the Rings" came this other Tolkien tale about little Bilbo & a big dragon

(4, 2).clue: In 2009 this player who holds the record for career steals slid free & clear into the Baseball Hall of Fame

(5, 2).clue: May 25, 2009: This reality show couple--"We might split up"; July 6: "(Him) to (her): get a lawyer"

(1, 3).clue: Edward Brooke was the first African American to hold this post for a state; Eric Holder is the first federal one

(2, 3).clue: To cook these vegetables O'Brien, dice them & fry them with onions & green peppers

(3, 3).clue: In addition to his Sherlock Holmes books, he wrote historical nonfiction like "The Great Boer War"

(4, 3).clue: In 1996 this "Golden Boy" TKOed Julio Cesar Chavez in 4 rounds; in '98, it took him 8

(5, 3).clue: In 2008, "A Decade After Revealing His Parkinson's", this movie & sitcom "Star Talks About How He and His Family Cope"

(1, 4).clue: Buzz Aldrin & Jim Lovell do look like twins as they prepare for a mission in this 1960s program

(2, 4).clue: In 1996 Dan O'Brien won a gold medal in this grueling Olympic sport, the first American to do so since Bruce Jenner

(3, 4).clue: In a review, Time magazine referred to the title man of this 1925 novel as a "Jazz Age zillionaire"

(4, 4).clue: As a rookie in 1975, this Chicago Bear led the league in kickoff returns; he went on to a "sweet" career as a running back

(5, 4).clue: On March 31, 2008 it was "Twin Bliss!  Intimate Photos at Home" with her, "Marc Anthony and Max and Emme"

(1, 5).clue: This man's 1807 steamboat run up the Hudson led to an 1824 Supreme Court decision on interstate commerce

(2, 5).clue: At the end of Prohibition in 1933, Pat O'Brien converted his speakeasy to a legal bar in this city

(3, 5).clue: In a Toni Morrison novel, Sethe kills her daughter named this so she won't know a life of servitude

(4, 5).clue: Until 1994 this right wing for the Detroit Red Wings held the NHL record for the most goals with 801

(5, 5).clue: December 17, 2007: "Stop Calling Me Fat!"; this "Ghost Whisperer" "Urges Women to 'Put on a Bikini and Stay Strong'"

(1, 1).clue: Formerly known as insulin dependent, type 1 of this disease accounts for only 5-10% of all cases of the disease

(2, 1).clue: Widower & sole dad Billy Ray Cyrus raises a pop star daughter on this Disney Channel sitcom

(3, 1).clue: Tell your old man to drag this '70s UCLA & Trail Blazer center (& Lanier!) up & down the court for 48 minutes

(4, 1).clue: This brilliant pianist's compositions include "Blue Monk" & "'Round Midnight"

(5, 1).clue: A Dutch flower seller once told me that daffodils & tulips are most often grown from these, not seeds

(6, 1).clue: Seabed samples suggest that this 970,000-square-mile sea between Europe & Africa was once largely dry

(1, 2).clue: Extreme cold can bring on hypothermia & this condition, when areas of skin & underlying tissue freeze

(2, 2).clue: David Hasselhoff was a divorced single dad on this '90s smash; luckily, he had a few babes around to console him

(3, 2).clue: Kirsten Gillibrand got her law degree from UCLA in 1991 & filled the Senate seat left vacant by this woman in 2009

(4, 2).clue: May 30, 2009 would have been the 100th birthday of this clarinetist & "King of Swing"

(5, 2).clue: My Latin teacher often reminded me that the name of this month comes from a Latin word meaning "'when flower buds open"

(6, 2).clue: The bottom of this ocean has a ridge that rises to form islands like Iceland & St. Helena

(1, 3).clue: A lumbar puncture, used to diagnose things like meningitis, is also called this

(2, 3).clue: The movie "Tin Men" said this classic TV Western was about "a 50-year-old father with three 47-year-old sons"

(3, 3).clue: Here's an offer you can't refuse: name this co-writer & director of "The Godfather"

(4, 3).clue: The Encyclopedia Britannica calls this Hot Five bandleader "the first superstar of jazz"

(6, 3).clue: A lowlife opportunist, or a fish like the lake sturgeon, which takes sustenance from the bed of big lakes

(1, 4).clue: One of the things the MMR vaccine protects against is this viral infection that causes swelling of the salivary glands

(2, 4).clue: His wife is killed in a courthouse shooting, leaving Detective Sipowicz to raise their baby boy alone in this cop drama

(4, 4).clue: A 2008 Grammy went to the Vanguard Jazz Orchestra's "Monday Night Live at" this venue

(6, 4).clue: The 600,000-square-mile bottom of this gulf off the southern U.S. includes the Sigsbee Abyssal Plain

(1, 5).clue: A.L.S., the most common form of motor neuron disease, is also named for him

(2, 5).clue: Widower Fred MacMurray raised Mike, Robbie, Chip & Ernie (go figure!) on this long-running comedy

(4, 5).clue: This Dave Brubeck Quartet tune got its title because it's played with an irregular quintuple time signature

(6, 5).clue: In 2008, over 65 years after it was sunk, HMAS Sydney was found 11/2 miles down in this ocean off Western Australia

(0, 0).clue: Trees with biblical names include the Joshua tree & the world's oldest tree, a 4,700-year-old pine named for him
